description: A dataset for predicting income levels based on census demographic information, frequently used for binary classification tasks in social sciences.

variables.meaning: The column 'age' contains data of type numerical. It represents the age of the observation.
The column 'workclass' contains data of type categorical. It represents the workclass of the observation.
The column 'fnlwgt' contains data of type numerical. It represents the fnlwgt of the observation.
The column 'education' contains data of type categorical. It represents the education of the observation.
The column 'marital-status' contains data of type categorical. It represents the marital-status of the observation.
The column 'occupation' contains data of type categorical. It represents the occupation of the observation.
The column 'relationship' contains data of type categorical. It represents the relationship of the observation.
The column 'race' contains data of type categorical. It represents the race of the observation.
The column 'gender' contains data of type categorical. It represents the gender of the observation.
The column 'capital-gain' contains data of type numerical. It represents the capital-gain of the observation.
The column 'capital-loss' contains data of type numerical. It represents the capital-loss of the observation.
The column 'hours-per-week' contains data of type numerical. It represents the hours-per-week of the observation.
The column 'native-country' contains data of type categorical. It represents the native-country of the observation.
The column 'income' contains data of type categorical. It represents the income of the observation.
